item.title: Website update with new sections
item.description: Just a little announcement today, I have added two new sections to the website: Links and Bookclub. Links should be pretty self-explanatory, on this page I collect links to interesting blogs, articles, documents….

KW1: Sigrid Nesterenko: Das unterschätzte Epstein Barr Virus: Was tun bei einer chronischen EBV-Infektion? KW2: Andreas Michalsen: Heilen mit der Kraft der Natur KW3: Jakob Lund Fisker: Early Retirement Extreme KW4: Ash Ali & Hasan Kubba: The unfair advantage KW4: Maren Schneider: Stressfrei durch Meditation KW5: Mike Cernovich: Gorilla Mindset KW5: Aldous Huxlex: Brave New World (Audiobook) KW5: Morgan Housel: The Psychology of Money KW6: Alexandra Barton: Recovery from CFS KW6: Austin Kleon: Show your Work KW7: Donald Miller: A Million Miles in a Thousand Years KW7: Austin Kleon: Keep going KW7: David Beales, Janice Benning, Helen Whitten, Julia MacDonald, Gina Johnson: Reclaim Health KW7: Austin Kleon: Steal like an Artist KW8: Ken Dychtwald: Körperbewusstsein KW8: Jeff Haden: The Motivation Myth KW9: James Clear: Atomic Habits KW10: Gerd Kommer: Souverän investieren mit Indexfonds & ETFs KW11: Eckhart Tolle: A New Earth KW12: Jacob Teitelbaum: From Fatigued to Fantastic KW13: Andreas Joppe: On/Off Gesundheit KW13: Steven Pressfield: The War of Art (Audiobook) KW13: Steven Pressfield: Turning Pro (Audiobook) KW14: Steven Pressfield: Do the work KW14: Tim Ferriss: Die 4-Stunden Woche KW15: Stephen King: The Green Mile KW16: Brown, Peter C.

Söhnke Ahrens: How to Take Smart Notes: One Simple Technique to Boost Writing, Learning and Thinking – for Students, Academics and Nonfiction Book Writers Martha Wells: Tagebuch eines Killerbots (Murderbot diaries) Chade-Meng Tan: Search Inside Yourself Martha Wells: Der Netzwerkeffekt (Murderbot diaries) Katharina Nocun, Pia Lamberty: Fake Facts.

Terry Pratchett, Stephen Baxter: Das Lange Utopia Terry Pratchett, Stephen Baxter: Der Lange Kosmos Logan Ury: How to not die alone Oliver Sax: Awakenings Blake Crouch: Recursion Katy Milkman: How to change Stanislaw Lem: Solaris Blake Crouch: Dark Matter Ryan Holiday: Conspiracy: Peter Thiel, Hulk Hogan, Gawker, and the Anatomy of Intrigue Daniel Suarez: Kill Decision Cal Newport: Eine Welt ohne E-Mail Christopher Browning: Ordinary Men Harry Potter und der Stein der Weisen Harry Potter und die Kammer des Schreckens Das Wunder von Narnia Harry Potter und der Feuerkelch Harry Potter und der Gefangene von Askaban Harry Potter und der Orden des Phoenix Harry Potter und der Halbblutprinz Harry Potter und die Heiligtümer des Todes Prince Harry: Spare Joe Haldeman: The Forever War Tom Hillebrandt: Drohnenland Max Brooks: Devolution Arthur C.

item.title: New Design and now also in German
item.description: The site is barely two months old and already the first redesign is coming. I didn’t really warm up to the old theme, but luckily Hugo makes it really easy to change the theme.

item.title: Old Computer Challenge 2023 - Epilogue
item.description: So the OCC 2023 ended almost three weeks ago and everyone went back to the year 2023 and to using their modern computers. At least I did. But let’s explore what remaind for me.

item.title: Old Computer Challenge - Days 6 and 7
item.description: So the last two days of the Old Computer Challenge went by in the blink of an eye, and not a lot has happened, so I’m putting them together in one post.

item.title: Old Computer Challenge - Day 5: Youtube Videos on an iPod Classic
item.description: Note This is only semi-related to the OldComputerChallenge, but I revisited the idea of downloading videos from Youtube and putting them on an old iPod. I had already figured out the commands a while ago, but I had to refresh my memory from my bash history and because I figure this might actually be of interest to some people, I wrote it as a tutorial.

item.title: Old Computer Challenge - Day 4
item.description: I want to take this post to get out some thoughts about the internet, social media and mental health. How is this related to the OldComputerChallenge? Let’s take a look.

item.title: Old Computer Challenge - Day 3
item.description: On this day I was sick, so not a lot has happened, but I would like to still briefly share a few thoughts. I’m spending far less time aimlessly surfing the web or watching youtube-videos for hours on end, simply because it’s not very much fun.

item.title: 82MHz
item.description: Hi, my name is Andi, I go by 82MHz online. Why 82MHz? Well one part comes from my year of birth, the other from the fact that I studied electrical engineering with a specialization in audio and telecommunications… get it?

item.title: Old Computer Challenge - Day 2
item.description: Day 2 is coming to a close. Today I was at work all day and so didn’t spend a whole lot of time on my slow computer. However, A thought occurred to me recently, because since I subscribed to mastodon a couple of weeks ago and especially since I started following some retro computing related postings (where I discoved the OCC in the first place), I discovered that there’s a thing called

item.title: Old Computer Challenge - Day 1
item.description: Okay, Day 1 is almost over, what have we learned? Modern software sucks!! I mean, it doesn’t really, a lot of it is quite beautiful and easy to use, but boy, everything consumes so many resources!

item.title: Old Computer Challenge - Preparation
item.description: This year I learned about Solene’s Old Computer Challenge, and I thought hey, I might give it a go! So this year the rules for the challenge are as follows:
